definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: The interim government has blamed ex-president Kurmanbek Bakiyev and his supporters.
sentences.chinese: 臨時政府譴責前總統巴基耶夫及其支持者。

sentences.english: The interim government is not blameless.
sentences.chinese: 臨時政府並非沒有過錯。

sentences.english: Several adjustments in personnel have been made to the composition of the first cabinet of the interim President.
sentences.chinese: 過渡時期臨時政府內閣人員已經做了一些調整。

sentences.english: He was elected Chairman of the provisional Central Government at the second All-China Congress.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次全國大會上，他被當選爲中央臨時政府主席。

sentences.english: The Constituent Assembly also has to appoint a president and form a temporary government.
sentences.chinese: 制憲議會還必須任命一位總統並組成臨時政府。

sentences.english: Kyrgyz interim gov't orders extradition of Bakiyev .
sentences.chinese: 吉臨時政府欲引渡流亡總統巴基耶夫。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
